title: Protection from Discrimination
content: The State recognises the right of all persons to equal treatment without discrimination and therefore prohibits discrimination on grounds of sex, race, colour, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, association with a national minority, property, birth or other status.
No law shall make any provision that is discriminatory either of itself or in its effect.
No person shall be treated in a discriminatory manner by any person acting by virtue of any written law or in the performance of the functions of any public office or any public authority.

Different treatment to persons according to their particular circumstances including gender, age, disability, or family responsibilities shall not be considered discriminatory if such treatment is justified in a democratic society.
